benchmark_details.name: Cross-Cultural Social Norms Dataset
benchmark_details.overview: We introduce the first cross-cultural dataset of over 10k shame/pride-related expressions with underlying social expectations from 5.4K Bollywood and Hollywood movies.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a dataset analyzing the psychosocial constructs underlying shame/pride-related expressions across cultures and the implicit social expectations behind them.

data.source: Collected English subtitles for 5,435 Bollywood and Hollywood movies released post-1990.
data.annotation: Manually annotated by authors and checked using GPT-4 for implicit expressions.

methodology.calculation: Through keyword search and analysis of dialogues for identifying shame and pride expressions.
methodology.interpretation: High specificity in social norms extracted from the dataset indicates cultural aspects of shame/pride.
methodology.validation: Manual verification by two human annotators.
